UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the FAHEMNY application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile, matches Firebase Auth UID.

rating.description: The user's average rating, from 1 to 5.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user profile was created.

SessionRequest.title: SessionRequest
SessionRequest.description: Represents a request for an explanation session posted by a student.

id.description: Unique identifier for the session request.

studentId.description: The ID of the student (UserProfile) who created the request.

tutorId.description: The ID of the tutor (UserProfile) who accepted the request.

field.description: The academic or professional field of the request (e.g., Physics, Programming).

description.description: Detailed description of what the student needs to understand.

price.description: The price offered by the student for the session.

sessionDate.description: The proposed date for the session.

sessionTime.description: The proposed time for the session.

tutorGender.description: The preferred gender of the tutor.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the request was posted.

studentRating.description: Rating (1-5) given by the tutor to the student.

tutorRating.description: Rating (1-5) given by the student to the tutor.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: Represents a financial transaction in a user's wallet.

amount.description: Transaction amount. Can be positive (credit) or negative (debit).

sessionId.description: Related session request ID, if applicable.

definition.description: Stores all session requests created by students.
Stores all wallet transactions for all users.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is simplified for the FAHEMNY app. It consists of two main collections: `userProfiles` for storing user data including their role (student or tutor), and `sessionRequests` for all tutoring requests. This flat structure is efficient for querying. `sessionRequests` can be queried by tutors, and students can view their own requests. Security rules will manage access based on user roles and ownership.
